    • Redefining Alzheimer's: From Symptoms to Biomarkers

Alzheimer's disease biomarkers

Source: R/biomarkers.R
biomarkers.Rd

Returns a tibble of curated biomarkers relevant to Alzheimer's disease and related neurodegenerative conditions. Each entry represents a measurable biological or imaging marker, including both original analyte-derived biomarkers and computed ratios or derived indicators.

Usage

biomarkers()

Value

A tibble with the following columns:

bmk_id

Short identifier for the biomarker (e.g., "ab42", "ptau181_ab42_ratio").

bmk_name

Human-readable label (e.g., "Aβ42 / Aβ40", "Amyloid PET").

bmk_category

Biomarker classification: "core", "non-specific", or "co-pathology".

bmk_subcategory

ATN or co-pathology label: "A", "T1", "T2", "N", "I", "V", "S".

bmk_modality

Measurement domain: "fluid", "imaging", or "hybrid".

bmk_type

Whether the biomarker is "original" (directly measured) or "derived" (computed).

analyte_ids

List of analyte IDs used to compute or define the biomarker.

bmk_desc

Concise description of biological relevance or measurement rationale.

notes

Optional comments or implementation notes.

Details

Biomarkers are classified according to category (e.g., core, non-specific, co-pathology), modality (fluid, imaging), and 2024's ATN or related subcategory ("A", "T1", "T2", "N", "I", "V", "S"). Both original and derived biomarkers are supported, and links to the underlying analyte(s) are included for provenance.

See also

analytes(), assays()

Examples

biomarkers()
#> # A tibble: 22 × 9
#>    bmk_id            bmk_name bmk_category bmk_subcategory bmk_modality bmk_type
#>    <chr>             <chr>    <chr>        <chr>           <chr>        <chr>   
#>  1 ab40              Aβ40     core         A               fluid        original
#>  2 ab42              Aβ42     core         A               fluid        original
#>  3 ab42-ab40-ratio   Aβ42 / … core         A               fluid        derived 
#>  4 amyloid_pet       Amyloid… core         A               imaging      original
#>  5 t-tau             Total t… core         T1              fluid        original
#>  6 ptau217           p-tau217 core         T1              fluid        original
#>  7 ptau181           p-tau181 core         T1              fluid        original
#>  8 ptau231           p-tau231 core         T1              fluid        original
#>  9 ptau181-ab42-rat… p-tau18… core         T1              fluid        derived 
#> 10 ptau217-np217-ra… p-tau21… core         T1              fluid        derived 
#> # ℹ 12 more rows
#> # ℹ 3 more variables: analyte_ids <list>, bmk_desc <chr>, notes <lgl>
